title: EP 9: Marc Zalmanoff - What Do You Mean My Fitness Affects My Business?
description:
Health and fitness coach. Personal Trainer. Gym owner. Name an occupation in the confines of the fitness industry, and Marc Zalmanoff (otherwise known as “Mark Z” or “The Fitness Ninja”) has probably done it. 

As the self-described “happiest person” people have ever met, Marc’s greatest gift is his ability to change the lives of those he works with. While other fitness trainers and instructors strictly prioritize short-term fitness gains, Marc instead values the consistent long-term growth of others over all else. From his holistic and bottom-up approach to health and wellness to his belief that a client/trainer relationship should last a lifetime, Marc’s lessons are not limited to working out; instead, they demonstrate that success in all walks of life only occurs with consistent, deliberate, repeatable, and intentional action.

On this episode of the Tactical Training Podcast, Steve Schabaker and fitness guest Marc Zalmanoff discuss how putting yourself in uncomfortable situations can help your business, the importance of establishing boundaries and limits in your day-to-day life, and how to make sustainable, consistent, and beneficial decisions amidst the hectic nature of the outside world. 

 

What You’ll Learn:

  • How Marc has used challenging, intense, and uncomfortable workouts to help him gain perspective and be a better entrepreneur
  • Why calendars and scheduling your day in minute detail is so vital to daily success
  • What long term, holistic fitness, and health looks like
  • Why living your best professional and personal life is simply about the "next choice"
  • And much more!

 

Favorite Quote:

“I think that's one of the biggest things that people miss in the fitness journey is… that it doesn't end. There's no endpoint to it. You can have a goal, and you can reach that goal... But there's no end to being fit.”

 

  • Marc Zalmanoff
